009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
021import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.EigenvalueDecomposition;
022import imagingbook.common.util.SortMap;
023
024/**
025 * This is an implementation of the algebraic circle fitting algorithm by Pratt [1],
026 * as described in [2] (Sec. 5.5-5.6). The algorithm uses singular-value decomposition
027 * (SVD) and eigen-decomposition. See [3, Alg. 11.2] for additional details.
028 * <p>
029 * Fits to exactly 3 (non-collinear) points are handled properly.
030 * Data centering is used to improve numerical stability (alternatively, a reference
031 * point can be specified).
032 * </p>
033 * <p>
034 * [1] V. Pratt. "Direct least-squares fitting of algebraic surfaces". <em>ACM
035 * SIGGRAPH Computer Graphics</em> <strong>21</strong>(4), 145â€“152 (July 1987).
036 * <br>
037 * [2] N. Chernov. "Circular and Linear Regression: Fitting Circles and
038 * Lines by Least Squares". Monographs on Statistics and Applied Probability.
039 * Taylor &amp; Francis (2011).
040 * <br>
041 * [3] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
042 * </p>
043 * 
044 * @author WB
045 *
046 */
047public class CircleFitPratt implements CircleFitAlgebraic {
048        
049        private static final RealMatrix Ci =    // inverse of constraint matrix C
050                        MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] { 
051                                {  0,   0, 0, -0.5 },
052                                {  0,   1, 0,  0 },
053                                {  0,   0, 1,  0 },
054                                { -0.5, 0, 0,  0 }});
055        
056        private final double[] q;       // q = (A,B,C,D) circle parameters
057        
058        @Override
059        public double[] getParameters() {
060                return this.q;
061        }
062        
063        /**
064         * Constructor.
065         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point.
066         * 
067         * @param points sample points
068         */
069        public CircleFitPratt(Pnt2d[] points) {
070                this(points, null);
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Constructor.
075         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point for data
076         * centering if {@code null} is passed for {@code xref}.
077         * 
078         * @param points sample points
079         * @param xref reference point or {@code null}
080         */
081        public CircleFitPratt(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
082                this.q = fit(points, xref);
083        }
084
085        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts, Pnt2d xref) {
086                final int n = pts.length;
087                if (n < 3) {
088                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 points are required");
089                }
090                
091                if (xref == null) {
092                        xref = PntUtils.centroid(pts);
093                }
094                final double xr = xref.getX();
095                final double yr = xref.getY();
096
097                double[][] Xa = new double[Math.max(n, 4)][4];  // Xa must have at least 4 rows!
098                for (int i = 0; i < pts.length; i++) {
099                        double x = pts[i].getX() - xr;          // = x_i
100                        double y = pts[i].getY() - yr;          // = y_i
101                        Xa[i][0] = sqr(x) + sqr(y);                     // = z_i
102                        Xa[i][1] = x;
103                        Xa[i][2] = y;
104                        Xa[i][3] = 1;
105                }
106                // if nPoints = 3 (special case) the last row of the
107                // 4x4 matrix contains all zeros (make X singular)!
108
109                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Xa);
110
111                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(X);
112                RealMatrix S = svd.getS();      
113                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
114                double[] svals = svd.getSingularValues();       // note: singular values are all positive (>= 0)
115                
116                int k = Matrix.idxMin(svals);
117                double smin = svals[k];
118                double smax = Matrix.max(svals); 
119                //int maxIdx = Matrix.idxMax(svals);
120                //double smax = svals[maxIdx];
121                
122                RealVector qq = null;           // = \dot{q} solution vector (algebraic circle parameters)
123
124                double icond = smin / smax;
125                if (icond < 1e-12) {                    // smin/smax = inverse condition number of X, 1e-12
126                        // singular case (X is rank deficient)
127                        qq = V.getColumnVector(k);
128                } else {
129                        // regular (non-singular) case
130                
131                        // Version1 ---------------------------------------------------
132//                      RealMatrix Y = V.multiply(S).multiply(V.transpose());
133//                      RealMatrix Z = Y.multiply(Ci).multiply(Y); // = Y * Ci * Y
134                        
135                        // Version2 ---------------------------------------------------
136                        RealMatrix Y = V.multiply(S);
137                        RealMatrix Z = Y.transpose().multiply(Ci).multiply(Y); // = Y^T * Ci * Y
138
139                        EigenvalueDecomposition ed = new EigenvalueDecomposition(Z);
140                        
141                        double[] evals = ed.getRealEigenvalues();
142                        
143//                      int l = getSmallestPositiveIdx(evals);
144                        int l = new SortMap(evals).getIndex(1); // index of the 2nd-smallest eigenvalue
145                        
146                        RealVector el = ed.getEigenvector(l);
147                        
148                        // Version1 ---------------------------------------------------
149//                      qq = Matrix.solve(S.multiply(svd.getVT()), el);         // solve S * V^T * p = el
150                        
151                        // Version2 ---------------------------------------------------
152                        qq = V.operate(MatrixUtils.inverse(S).operate(el));     // simpler since S is diagonal
153                }
154
155                RealMatrix M = CircleFitAlgebraic.getDecenteringMatrix(xr, yr);
156                return M.operate(qq).toArray();  // q = (A,B,C,D)
157        }
158        
159//      private int getSmallestPositiveIdx(double[] x) {
160//              double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
161//              int minidx = -1;
162//              for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
163//                      // ignore complex eigenvalues (x[i] == NaN)
164//                      if (Double.isFinite(x[i]) && x[i] >= 0 && x[i] < minval) {
165//                              minval = x[i];
166//                              minidx = i;
167//                      }
168//              }
169//              return minidx;
170//      }
171
172
173        // enforce constraint B^2 + C^2 - 4 A D = 1 :
174        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
175        private double[] normalizeP(double[] q) {
176                final double A = q[0];
177                final double B = q[1];
178                final double C = q[2];
179                final double D = q[3];
180                double s  = Math.sqrt(sqr(B) + sqr(C) - 4 * A * D);
181                return new double[] {A/s, B/s, C/s, D/s};
182        }
183}
